conbody.p: This document introduces you to the Multimedia Hardware Adaptation Interfaces collection.

section.title: Purpose
section.p:
The Multimedia Hardware Adaptation Interfaces (HAI) collection defines hardware-independent interfaces for controlling the hardware component, such as:
Mobile TV reception
Video hardware

section.title: Architectural Relationship
section.p: Symbian provides APIs for use by hardware integrators so they can implement their own mobile TV solutions.

The APIs are introduced with their components. The Multimedia components DevVideo and DevSound provide APIs for handling the media data once the raw data stream has been extracted by the Multimedia HAI components.

section.title: Description
section.p: The Multimedia HAI provides support for controlling the hardware component, and handling the data streams.

The APIs provided make it possible to write an implementation of a supported mobile TV standard that can control and manage the incoming signals including splitting the signal into an audio, video and information stream.

section.title: Supported Mobile TV standards
section.p: Support is currently provided for the DVB-H (Digital Video Broadcast-Handset) transmission standard. DVB-H is a superset of the DVB-T (Digital Video Broadcast-Terrestrial) standard.

section.title: Mobile TV DVB-H Receiver HAI
section.p: The Mobile TV DVB-H Receiver HAI allows an implementation to be written for the only (currently) supported mobile TV standard, DVB-H.

section.title: Video HAI
section.p: The Video HAI defines an interface for plug-ins that provide video functionality.

section.title: Using Multimedia HAI
section.p: Hardware integrators can write device drivers or servers to manage the component like:
